intro: Cyrtandra rudiculata, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as rainforests and streamside areas. It is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests, contributing to the ecological diversity of these ecosystems. Cyrtandra rudiculata is also notable for its role in traditional Hawaiian culture and conservation efforts.
